5a,c¨Cg,i,kRecently, we discovered the mu lti-component synthesis ofoctahedral [6+12] polyimine nanocapsule Cd6La12that formedin close to 80% yield upon reacting six cavitands Cdwith twelveethylene diamines La(Chart 1).5bUnfortunately, this approachcould not be extended to other 1, n-alkanediamine s, which yieldedoctaimine hemicarcerands, or to rigid linear aryldiamines Lx(x=a¨Cc), which quantitatively a?o rded tetrahedral [4+8]-polyimine capsules Cd4Lx8(x=a¨Cc).5d,6We rationalized theseobservations with the geometry of cavitand Cd, in which oppositearyl units form angles of 65.4 1, which is better suited for [4+8]-capsules Cy4Lx8than for octahedral [6+12]-capsules Cy6Lx12/C1Herein, we describe the development of a rational approachtowards the assembly of covalent Schi? base octahedrons basedon an optimized cavitand-vertex geometry. To be an idealoctahedron vertex, the vectors connecting aryl-C1 and C4 inopposite aryl units of the cavit and should be orthogonal to eachother (Fig. 1). This geometry can be achieved by increasing theO¨C(CH2)n¨CO spanner length, which ?attens out the cavitand.

In modelling studies, the angles are 85.4 1in the C4symmetricconformations of CbandCeand 93.7 1inCcandCf,w h i c ha r eclose to ideal (Fig. 2). Nevertheless, the condensation of Cewithtwo equivalents of ethylene-1,2-diamine ( La)g a v eac o m p l e xmixture composed of multiple capsules with 2¨C6 cavitands. Asimilar condensation reaction of Cfyielded not the expectedoctahedral capsule, but the tetrahedral [4+8]-assembly Cf4La8,5lChart 1 Hemicarcerands Cy2Lx4, polyimine capsules Cy2Lx4,Cy4Lx8,Cy6Lx12and Cy6T8, cavitand Cy, and di- ( Lx) and triamines T.

Rigidity of the linker and the cavitand unit is essential forsuccessful octahedron synthesis. For example, reaction of Cbwith two equivalents of either LaorLdgave the entropicallymore favorable [2+4] octaimine hemicarcerands (Table 1).Presumably, adjustment of the central dihedral angle of eachlinker led to formation of [2+4] condensation products withlittle conformational strain. Likewise, the increased ?exibilityof cavitand Ccleads to complex mixtures despite that the C4symmetric conformation of Ccis slightly better suited as anFig. 2 Energy minimized structures of cavitand Cc(A¨CC) andCb(D¨CF) with R = CH 3. Lowest energy C2vsymmetric conformations(A) and (D) and C4dsymmetric conformations (B), (C), (E) and (F).

The outcome of capsulesynthesis using Cbcontrasts that of Ca, which gave tetrahedral[4+8] polyimine nanocapsules Ca4Lx8(x=b¨Cd) as majorproducts in its reaction with diamines Lx(x=b¨Cd). The latterresults are consistent with condensation reactions of Cd,5dandsupport our earlier suggestion that cavitands with OCH 2Ospanners intrinsically prefer formation of tetrahedral capsules,if reacted with a linear linker.

Indeed, TFA-catalyzed condensation of six equivalents ofcavitand Cbwith 12 equivalents of phenylene-1,4-diamine ( Lb)quantitatively a?orded the desired octahedral [6+12]-polyiminenanocapsule Cb6Lb12within three hours.8The assignment ofthis product to octahedral Cb6Lb12i sb a s e do ni t sM A L D I - T O Fmass spectrum, which shows an isotopic cluster at the expectedmass-to-charge ratio m/z= 8603.10 ( m/z= 8603.36 calculatedfor [Cb6Lb12+H ]+), its gel permeation chromatogram (GPC)and1H and13C NMR spectra (Fig. 3A, D, and F). The1H NMR spectrum of Cb6Lb12shows one multiplet each forthe imine protons, H im, the aryl protons H a2,H a3,H a1andHa4, the benzylic protons H mand the ethylene protons H o,Hiatd8.53, 7.93, 7.67, 7.31, 7.26, 5.30, 3.89 and 3.46, respectively, in ar a t i o 2 4:4 8:2 4:4 8:9 6:2 4:4 8:4 8 , w h i c h i s c o n s i s t e n t w i t h a noctahedron.
